original_title: Dengue Prevention Assistants to be absorbed into permanent cadre: Keheliya
original_body_lines: Steps will be taken to absorb the Dengue Prevention Assistants to the permanent cadre, though the Department of Management Services has objected to making them permanent, Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said today.
The Minister told Parliament that he had submitted three Cabinet Papers regarding the matter and that the Department of Management Services has objected to the move.

"These Dengue Prevention Assistants were recruited in 2016, without basic qualifications. However, they have served for eight years. We cannot consider their qualifications now. I have submitted three Cabinet Papers to make them permanent. However, the Department of Management Services has objected to it. I have signed another Cabinet Paper to be presented at the next Cabinet meeting. I have decided to personally meet the officials of the Department of Management Services regarding the matter," he said.
The Minister said this in response to a question by Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa whether some 8,000 Dengue Prevention Assistants would be absorbed to the permanent cadre.
The Minister said these Dengue Prevention Assistants were paid only Rs. 700 per day. (Ajith Siriwardana and Yiohan Perera)
